Description of the GRID db

Source: vignettes/meta.Rmd
meta.Rmd

Database content

The tables in the database have the following table names, column names and row and column counts:

library(institutions)
library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
library(purrr)
library(knitr)

institutions_download()

# fcn to describe a table

desc_table <- function(x)
  tibble(
    tablename = x,
    rowcount = institutions_table(x) %>% nrow(),
    colcount = institutions_table(x) %>% ncol(),
    colnames = institutions_table(x) %>% names() %>% paste0(collapse = ", ")
  )

# iterate over existing tables and display results

tables <- institutions_tables()

desc <-
 tables %>% map_df(desc_table) %>%
 arrange(desc(rowcount))

knitr::kable(desc)
tablename rowcount colcount colnames
external_ids 202501 3 grid_id, external_id_type, external_id
addresses 97819 14 grid_id, line_1, line_2, line_3, lat, lng, postcode, primary, city, state, state_code, country, country_code, geonames_city_id
grid 97819 5 ID, Name, City, State, Country
institutes 97819 5 grid_id, name, wikipedia_url, email_address, established
types 95613 2 grid_id, type
links 88202 2 grid_id, link
acronyms 39015 2 grid_id, acronym
relationships 34660 3 grid_id, relationship_type, related_grid_id
labels 24755 3 grid_id, iso639, label
aliases 22070 2 grid_id, alias
geonames 14303 14 geonames_city_id, city, nuts_level1_code, nuts_level1_name, nuts_level2_code, nuts_level2_name, nuts_level3_code, nuts_level3_name, geonames_admin1_code, geonames_admin1_name, geonames_admin1_ascii_name, geonames_admin2_code, geonames_admin2_name, geonames_admin2_ascii_name

The tables in the database are based on the CSV format. This format is described in more detail here: https://grid.ac/format.

Size on disk

The size on disk for some of the generated files (the SQLite db is larger than the zipped CSVs downloaded due to the Full Text Search tables that are generated and added to the database):

cfg <- institutions_cfg()

print_fs <- function(x)
  sprintf("File %s has size %s", basename(x),
          utils:::format.object_size(file.info(x)$size, "auto"))

files <- c(cfg$zip, cfg$db)

sizes <- map_chr(files, print_fs)

File grid.zip has size 33.8 Mb

File grid.db has size 54.3 Mb
